label: Description
value: Button depicting scene with four figures in a landscape with palm trees. At left, a light-skinned man at entrance of a hut, as black-skinned man and woman, dressed in Western style working clothes, converse with another woman who wears only a skirt, carrying a child on her back and a package on her head.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint on ivory verre fixé (affixed to) glass, ivory (backing), gilt metal

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 1 x 3.7 cm (3/8 x 1 7/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: c. 1802: Toussaint L'Ouverture, upon return to France from Haiti and Santo Domingo gives jacket with these buttons to servant boy [1];  acquired by boy's heirs in the Sedan;  Professor Lalongt, College of Sedan acquires from heirs [2];  ? - 1939: sold to Etienne Accary, Paris; 1939: his sale, Salle Drouot auction house, Paris [3];  1939: purchased by Pauline Riggs Noyes [Mrs. Robert B. Noyes], Pomfret, Connecticut, and New York; 1942-1949: on long-term loan to the Cooper Union Museum 1949: gift to the Museum from the estate of Mrs. Noyes   [1] Given to servant boy for his loyal service to Toussaint L'Ouverture  in the prison in Besancon, France from his capture in Haiti to his death in Besancon in 1813 [2] Letter from Jean Milare tells story of servant boy and Toussaint [3] Buttons arrive, possibly as a loan, at Cooper Union Museum around 1942

label: Credit line
value: Gift of R. Keith Kane from the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes

label: Description
value: Button depicting scene of three women in the foreground and a seated man in the background in a partial landscape. The women are all wearing white dresses, turbans and scarves around their necks. The central figure wears a dark turban and has lighter skin than the other two.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of R. Keith Kane from the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes

label: Description
value: Circular form with painted scene depicting light skinned woman on left in white, low cut bodice with mid-length, ruffled sleeves, loose white overskirt, longer light blue underskirt, barefeet, white scarf on head, and long, tied black ribbon around her neck. She lifts skirts slightly while gazing at black man to her right; he wears short orange and brown skirt, possibly feathered, with brown strap draped diagonally across his bare chest and tall, orange feathered headdress. His left hand is on his hip while he points downward with his right hand as he gestures to the lighter skinned woman. Behind him to the right are two black women: one wears long orange, white, and black vertically striped skirt, scarf with black and orange stripes, draped head scarf with orange stripes, and gold beaded choker around neck; second woman at extreme right with her back turned to viewer wears long gold, white, and black vertically striped skirt, orange and white scarf draped over shoulders, white blouse with 3/4 length sleeves, tall orange and white turban on her head, and white pendant earrings; both women gaze at the other two figures. Landscape of palms and other plant life in background, as well as indigenous architecture at rear left. Sky painted in pale blue and orange tones. Painting protected by domed glass and framed in gilded metal. Plain metal loop attached to center of reverse side.

label: Physical description
value: Gouache paint verre fixeé, ivory (backing), glass, gilt metal

label: Credit line
value: Gift of R. Keith Kane from the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes

label: Notes
value: Circular form with painted scene depicting light skinned woman on left in white, low cut bodice with mid-length, ruffled sleeves, loose white overskirt, longer light blue underskirt, barefeet, white scarf on head, and long, tied black ribbon around her neck. She lifts skirts slightly while gazing at black man to her right; he wears short orange and brown skirt, possibly feathered, with brown strap draped diagonally across his bare chest and tall, orange feathered headdress. His left hand is on his hip while he points downward with his right hand as he gestures to the lighter skinned woman. Behind him to the right are two black women: one wears long orange, white, and black vertically striped skirt, scarf with black and orange stripes, draped head scarf with orange stripes, and gold beaded choker around neck; second woman at extreme right with her back turned to viewer wears long gold, white, and black vertically striped skirt, orange and white scarf draped over shoulders, white blouse with 3/4 length sleeves, tall orange and white turban on her head, and white pendant earrings; both women gaze at the other two figures. Landscape of palms and other plant life in background, as well as indigenous architecture at rear left. Sky painted in pale blue and orange tones. Painting protected by domed glass and framed in gilded metal. Plain metal loop attached to center of reverse side.

label: Description
value: Horizontal cream ribbon connects bunch of pink roses with smaller motifs of two pink rose buds. Ground has staggered rows of striped horizontal figures; printed on graded cream and tan ground. Two identical borders to the width.

label: Description
value: Oval with rose cluster and rose sprays framed in approximately horizontal rectangle with scroll outline is major motif. This repeats horizontally with vertical scroll motif intervening. To be cut along center. Printed in eight colors on pale blue ground.

label: Description
value: Bold leafy scrolls with small pink roses alternate in checkered fashion with delicate ropes of small flowers forming eight-pointed star centered with small flower and bud. Printed on pink ground.

label: Description
value: A series of approximately circular figures, the largest of which has scrolled frame with red center motifs. Printed in gold, white and red on dull yellow embossed ground.

label: Description
value: Graded vertical lines spaced with vertical dotted bands. The latter are broken at intervals by motif of simple pink rose surrounded by green leaves and pin dot decoration. Roses are in drop repeating relationship. Drop match. Printed in five colors and gold on neutral ground.

label: Description
value: Drop-repeating design of rococo enframement or cartouche containing floral spray. The ground is sown with gold fleur-de-lis. Printed in colors and gold on dark blue embossed ground.

label: Provenance
value: Used in a bedroom in the home of A.E. Coleman, Norman, Oklahoma.

label: Description
value: Rows of drop-repeating conventionalized flower forms surrounded by acanthus leaves with geometric stem; printed in light brown on brown ground.

label: Provenance
value: Used in upstairs hall in house in Morman, Oklahoma. Town founded in 1889 asland grant.

label: Description
value: Diagonal rows of scroll-enframed figures of various shapes. A near geometrical feeling results. Figures are not large. The most elaborate motif has leafy forms in pink and silver.

label: Description
value: Twisting acanthus octagonal framework centered with leafy forms interlock in all-over pattern. Printed on light tan ground.

label: Description
value: Tan colored ingrain paper with no printed design, contains many grayish fibers.

label: Provenance
value: Used in the house of Mr. and Mrs. A.E. Coleman, 315 East Symones, Norman, Oklahoma. House built in 1889 when town was founded as land grant.
